channel.title: What do people want?
channel.description: I am going to start a new server from either a blank delta or czar, but I don't know what to put in it. So I want to know what you all think I should put in it to make it better. Please comment on this because I really need ideas.

item.title: What do people want?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

All noncombat stats working. Custom Minigames that make people WOW. Good economy (so not everyone has ags and shit)

Read full topic

item.title: What do people want?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:2, topic:341430”]good economy
good pking
not fast or slow training
good shops but don’t sell over powered things
higher leveled skills = more reward
good combat
duel arena but i think thats just me personally. ive always had an orgasm for it[/quote]

This. Don’t make experience rates extremely slow like RuneScape and don’t make them 3 clicks on an npc/object for 99. Make sure that powerful weapons aren’t easily obtained - make them a challenging drop and never have them sold in shops.

My old server had no economy but the giant stacks of cash and high hits made people enjoy it more it seemed, so you decide.

Read full topic

item.title: What do people want?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Not using delta, is what I want

Sorry, trying to act cool.

But anyhow, what Chaos said.

Read full topic

item.title: What do people want?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

b b0yz 4:

What do you mean by good economy?

As in, stuff is not soo common, that you can get them given to you, for example, the AllStar economy, almost every item is EASILY obtained.

As well as, not such a rare item, that it would take you a month to get the cash for it? Sure, if the server is still starting out, its understandable, but if an item is, for example, 1.5B, thats a hint it needs to be a little bit less rare.

Read full topic
